alert.note: Alert for Socorro; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following counties, Socorro and Torrance. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slow and erratically around Los Pinos Mountains and rural northeast Socorro County. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over parts of the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... State Road 55 near Gran Quivira, County Roads B121, B127, B175, A127, A147, and Conante Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
